info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Missoula and north central Ravalli Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 328 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Missoula, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, Wye, East Missoula, Evaro, Florence, Twin Creeks and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 93 and 117. Highway 93 between mile markers 0 and 3. Highway 93 S between mile markers 77 and 94. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
